note:
Enter the grant date for the ESPP lots in this column.

This will be used to retrieve the market value for that date.

See https://github.com/hickeng/financial/blob/main/usage.md#espp for details

Enter the Purchase Date for the ESPP lots in this column.

This will be used to retrieve the market value for that date.

See https://github.com/hickeng/financial/blob/main/usage.md#espp for details

Enter the number of shares from this ESPP lot that you held over the date of the merger.

This is the value from "Shares Purchased" and NOT from "Total shares Purchased for Offering". If you've sold any since release, adjust the number to reflect that.

See https://github.com/hickeng/financial/blob/main/usage.md#espp

This is an optional field to let you capture the per-offering period contribution you made.

This feeds into a set of informational calculations regarding precise dollars invested but is NOT used in the merger calc and can be safely omitted.

data: Derived - should match vlaues from ESPP purchase confirmation

note:
This is an optional field to let you capture the per-offering period contribution you made.

Put the Previous Carry Forward from your earliest ESPP confirmation for shares you still own into this cell and it'll propagate down.

This calc is only useful if you've kept whole lots without gaps. If not, just enter the value from the Purchase Confirmation, or omit completely - this column does NOT feed into the merger calculation.

This is an optional input.

You can use it to:
a. track the qty that etrade assocaited with the lot
b. use a derived per-lot ratio for cash/stack from etrade's number by setting the "Cash/stock ratio" tweak on the Summary page to "Pro-rata - from eTrade share qty"

This is the quantities of converted shares from eTrade lots as reported by eTrade. The colour of the cell will alter slightly if the value here does not equal the value calculated via AVGO ratio.

You can toggle whether to use this manual value or the calculated value in the Tweaks on the first Sheet.

If this is the lot from which a fraction was taken by etrade then you should add then fractional AVGO quantity back into this value and check the Fraction box. See the note on the fraction column.

Almost everyone will have a fractional AVGO share after conversion. For many people this is take from their oldest or newest lot. 

Check the box for the lot the fraction was taken from and add the fractional amount back into to "AVGO qty from eTrade" column.
See the usage docs for details on how to determine the appropriate lot

https://github.com/hickeng/financial/blob/main/usage.md#factional-share


Notes:
If the fractional share should come out of a specific lot, or set of lots, check those lots here. If multiple are selected the sheet will spread the fraction equally over those lots, accounting for differences in cost-basis.

If it came out of an ESPP lot, that's a sale and will incur the ordinary income portion of tax shown in column "Income & short term gain".

The fractional quantity should be added back into "AVGO qty from eTrade" column for the lot that eTrade took it from.
This is done because we need the cost-basis of the lot calculated _before_ that fraction is removed as it's a serial conversion - convert entire lot, THEN sell factional part. It also avoids substantial complexity in formulae.
Pre-filled with 0.00 because that's what eTrade has reported for everyone.
This value is calculated from the VMW -> AVGO ratio for the lot
Manual user entry per lot if using a per-lot election instead of pro-rata

This is an optional field.

The value selected here will only reflect in the wider sheet if the "Per-lot - from strategy or manual selection" has been selected for the ratio source in the Tweaks on the Summary sheet.

The cost basis is the actual price paid per share times the number of shares, plus the ordinary income on sale.

Working on the assumption that the merger does not count as a sale for non-cash lots, the basis shouldn't be adjusted here. HOWEVER.... we do want to consider the basis adjustment from the perspective of lot selection.

This should exactly equal the value in the "AVGO qty from eTrade" column as it's literally inverted the calc.

This column is here purely for consistency so we can see all three stock columns together

data: =LET(cashReceived,AA7, alternateGainAmount,AJ7, numAvgo,AI7, imputedIncome,BB7, MIN(cashReceived, alternateGainAmount) - IF(numAvgo=0,imputedIncome,0))
note:
This is the gain realized for the lot.

The cell will be shaded in a darker blue if the alternative gain calculation from Form 8937 applies. The standard blue means the gain realized is amount of cash received for the lot.

data: =LET(cashReceived,AA8, alternateGainAmount,AJ8, numAvgo,AI8, imputedIncome,BB8, MIN(cashReceived, alternateGainAmount) - IF(numAvgo=0,imputedIncome,0))

note:
This pulls in the ordinary income portion for the fractional share if associated with the lot.

If there are no AVGO shares received for the lot, then the ordinary income cannot be deferred to future sale and must be counted.

data:
=IFERROR(LET(
imputedIncome,BB7,
avgoQty,AI7, 
perAvgoIncome, iferror(imputedIncome/avgoQty,0),
purchaseDate,C7,
mergerDate,Reference!$B$28,
lotFractionAmount,AK7,
lotFractionGain,AL7,
mergerGain,AM7,
shortTermGain,IF(DATEDIF(purchaseDate,mergerDate,"Y")>=1,
  0,
  lotFractionGain + mergerGain
),
incomeOnFraction,perAvgoIncome*lotFractionAmount, 
shortTermGain + incomeOnFraction + IF(avgoQty=0,imputedIncome-incomeOnFraction,0)),0)

=IFERROR(
LET(
purchaseDate,C7,
mergerDate,Reference!$B$28,
lotFractionGain,AL7,
mergerGain,AM7,
IF(DATEDIF(purchaseDate,mergerDate,"Y")>=1,
  lotFractionGain+mergerGain,
  0
)),0)
=IF(DATEDIF(L7,Reference!$B$28,"Y")>=1,"Part II Box D","Part I Box A")

note:
This is the pro-rata cash portion that eTrade have used per lot and reported on the 1099-B.

This is useful to disambiguate which lot is which when there are multiple on a single date.

data: NOTE: costbasis.com recommends attaching a statement explaining adjustment to proceeds

=LET(
cashReceived,AA7, 
avgoQty,AI7, 
proceedsStyle,Reference!$E$9, 
avgoFMV,Reference!$B$18, 
SWITCH(proceedsStyle, "combined", cashReceived +(avgoQty*avgoFMV), "cashOnly", cashReceived))

note:
Using calc from https://www.irs.gov/instructions/i8949#en_US_2022_publink1000114401

It's negative because the Form instructions require gain to be:
d - e + g

data:
=LET(
proceedsStyle,Reference!$E$9,
proceeds,AS7,
gain,AW7,
numVmwShares,D7, 
vmwBasis, AD7, 
avgoQty,AI7, 
avgoFMV,Reference!$B$18, 
cashReceived,AA7, 
avgoTotalValue, avgoFMV*avgoQty, 
vmwTotalBasis, vmwBasis*numVmwShares,
alternateGainAmount,AJ7, 
basis1099B, AT7,
SWITCH(proceedsStyle,
  "cashOnly",
    gain - proceeds + basis1099B,
  "combined",
    basis1099B - IF(cashReceived<alternateGainAmount,
      avgoTotalValue,
      vmwTotalBasis
  )
))

note: Not allowed to recognize a loss. I'm assuming that applies at a share level rather than the aggregate holding absent explicit indication otherwise.

data: =LET(proceedsStyle,Reference!$E$9, proceeds,AS7, basis1099B, AT7, adjustment,AV7, SWITCH(proceedsStyle, "cashOnly", AM7, "combined", MAX(proceeds - basis1099B + adjustment, 0)))

note:
This is the pure adjusted basis without Ordinary Income factored in.

The only time I can think of that you'd need this is if you need to give it to a broker to update basis in their systems.

On sale, you should be using the basis with Ordinary Income added in.

data: =LET(vmwBasis,AD7, numShares,D7, cashReceived,AA7, gainRecognized,AM7, isQualified,BA7, imputedIncome,BB7, avgoQty,AI7, IFERROR( ((vmwBasis*numShares) - cashReceived + gainRecognized)/avgoQty, "n/a"))
AVGO basis adjusted by Ordinary Income
note:
When selling ESPP shares, the tax basis includes the reported ordinary income.

See https://github.com/hickeng/financial/issues/15#issuecomment-1947700730

data: =LET(vmwBasis,AD7, numShares,D7, cashReceived,AA7, gainRecognized,AM7, isQualified,BA7, imputedIncome,BB7, avgoQty,AI7, IFERROR( ((vmwBasis*numShares) - cashReceived + gainRecognized + imputedIncome)/avgoQty, "n/a"))
=LET(saleFMV,Reference!$B$10, postMergerBasis,AY7, avgoQty,AI7, lotFractionAmount,AK7, iferror((saleFMV - postMergerBasis) * (avgoQty - lotFractionAmount), 0))

=LET(
vmwBasis,AD7,
numVmwShares,D7,
cashReceived,AA7,
gainRecognized,AM7,
pureAvgoBasis,AX7,
isQualified,BA7,
saleFMV,Reference!$B$10,
actualPrice,L7,
purchaseDateFMV,F7,
grantDateFMV,E7,
gainFromSale,IFERROR(saleFMV - pureAvgoBasis, 0),
disqualifiedIncome,(purchaseDateFMV - actualPrice),
qualifiedIncome,MIN(
   gainFromSale,
   (0.15 * grantDateFMV)),
income,IF(isQualified,
   qualifiedIncome,
   disqualifiedIncome),
numVmwShares * income)

=LET(
avgoQty,AI7, 
purchaseDate,C7,
postMergerSaleDate,Reference!$B$29,
saleFMV,Reference!$B$10,
postMergerBasis,AY7, 
IF(DATEDIF(purchaseDate,postMergerSaleDate,"Y")>=1,
  0,
  avgoQty * (saleFMV - postMergerBasis)
))

=LET(
avgoQty,AI7, 
purchaseDate,C7,
postMergerSaleDate,Reference!$B$29,
saleFMV,Reference!$B$10,
postMergerBasis,AY7, 
IFERROR(IF(DATEDIF(purchaseDate,postMergerSaleDate,"Y")>=1,
  avgoQty * (saleFMV - postMergerBasis),
  0
),0))
